question: 節句
sourceMnemonic: Think of what a <kanji>paragraph</kanji> of a <kanji>season</kanji> would be. It's a small part of the season, but it's worth writing about. That's a <vocabulary>seasonal festival</vocabulary>. These are fun!
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. Just note that <ja>せつ</ja> gets shortened to <ja>せっ</ja> just like many <ja>つ</ja>s do in this situation.
